definitions.example: The rubbish is collected every Thursday in Gloucester, but on Wednesdays in Cheltenham.

definitions.definition: (by extension) An item, or items, of low quality.
definitions.example: Much of what they sell is rubbish.
Everything the teacher said during that lesson was rubbish. How can she possibly think that a bass viol and a cello are the same thing?

definitions.definition: To criticize, to denigrate, to denounce, to disparage.

definitions.example: This has been a rubbish day, and it’s about to get worse: my mother-in-law is coming to stay.

definitions.definition: Used to express that something is exceedingly bad, awful, or terrible.
definitions.example:
The one day I actually practice my violin, the teacher cancels the lesson.
Aw, rubbish! Though at least this means you have time to play football.

definitions.definition: Used to express that what was recently said is nonsense or untrue; balderdash!, nonsense!
definitions.example: Rubbish! I did nothing of the sort!
